Reviews.Title: “Standard no fuss hotel”
Reviews.Author: stuman48
Reviews.Content: After much searching for a weekend stay in Sydney I finally came acroos the Leisure Inn Sydney Central. We were a family of four traveling with another family of five from Melbourne. It was hard trying to find a hotel that would house both families but the Leisure in fit the bill. My family had the quad room on the sixth floor with a street view while our traveling companiens had a family room on the first floor. The hotel is about a half hour walk or so from the Opera House down on Circcular Quey. We had five kids all under the age of 12 and all of them had no trouble with the walk. There are many buses along George street you can catch if your not up to walking. China town is close by with lots of food options. We caught a train to the Bondi junction then took a bus to Bondi Beach which was alot of fun and we saw some of the cast from Bondi Rescue patrolling the beach. My daughter thought that was awesome. If your up for a fun night out try the Wentworth greyhound races just a ten minute walk away. Back to the hotel, all was fine the bed was comfy and the bathroom clean. The only thing the hotel could do would be to touch up the lower parts of the paint on the walls of the room as there were alot of scuff marks from peoples luggage. The elevator was extremly slow but all in all I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a night or 2”
Reviews.Author: Eerinbmac
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and found it basic but comfortable. My intital interaction with reception was less than impressive but the next lady I encountered during both check in and check out was lovely. It's nothing special but we weren't there much anyway. Had a hot shower which was a god send after getting caught in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 night...”
Reviews.Author: luisa_c15
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a Saturday night, it's close to Central Station within walking distance. I got to the Reception where there was no one there for a long time. I had to wait about 10 mins for someone to arrive at the counter. The male who was there explained that there are extra costs for late checkout after 10.30am? or 11.00am? on a sliding scale. The more later you check out, the more it will cost!!!! which i thought was exorbitant. Not only that, there's no free WIFI and internet charges are expensive. Also, the reception is only open at certain times and if you don't have your keycard when reception is closed, to enter the door... they will have to call a locksmith and you will incur the cost. (i was advised when i was checking in) the room itself was OK....bed was a bit soft. I was in the hotel room with double bed and shower. The shower was good, but the walls are paper thin. I could hear next door talking. I think this stay is OK for one night but not anymore. I stayed here on a Saturday night and paid AUD$189. The reason i chose it is because it's cheaper than most other hotels in the Sydney CBD area on a Satuday night. But I dont think it's worth that money.

Reviews.Title: “What a dive”
Reviews.Author: CarolWoc
Reviews.Content: The service was terrible and the room was noisy next to the air con for the whole floor. Could not wait to get out of there. We switched hotels, had to pay for one night anyhow, which I understood. The single bed had a dip in the middle and the TV was tiny.

Reviews.Title: “For $154/night, you too can have a room the size of a closet!”
Reviews.Author: SarahJane0488
Reviews.Content: Our "Standard twin room" wasn't even wide enough for a double bed. Most hostels offer more space for under $100 for a private room. The woman who checked us in was extremely rude, and insisted on explaining a pre-authorization on my credit card in three different ways, despite my very clear "I understand"s. Beware - the reception closes 9pm - 7am and if you lose your key and require assistance to enter your room, a $75 charge applies. It's time for this hotel to staff its desk 24-hours, especially when charging rates over $150/night. It's a short-term stay hotel, not an apartment complex.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints about convenient location, reasonable price, basic room”
Reviews.Author: nyalpi
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights in order to attend a meeting in Sydney, and I'll consider staying there again in the future for short business trips (not at all the type of place I'd stay for a vacation). Good price at A$130 per night. Very close to Central Station (5 minutes walk), so easy to get to and from airport. About 10-15 minutes walk to Chinatown, plus plenty of other restaurants within 5-10 minutes walk. After reading the reviews, I was prepared for a room with no windows. I had a room with a window -- but there was a wall within 1 metre of a window, and that was the only view! That didn't matter to me because I was only really there to sleep. Small but adequately sized room. Very reasonable bathroom. Soap from a soap dispenser (first time I've seen it -- much more environmentally friendly than throwing away a bar of soap after every guest). Simple and clean and not at all fancy. Small hole in the blanket and lots of scratch marks on the wall (from suitcases), but didn't affect the overall comfort or functionality. Appears to have reasonable security -- swipe card required to use the elevator. No complaints about reception.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: AngieSF
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over NYE weekend and got fully gouged on the room rate, at about 4 times the normal price. We knew that this would be the case, and certainly the Leisure Inn was one of the (comparatively) less expensive options in Sydney that weekend, but the rate we paid made it especially painful when the hotel nickel and dimed us for every conceivable thing - $15 for a day on Internet access, $1 to place a local call plus $1 per minute for the call itself, $2 per bag to store bags after check-out, etc. etc. This place seemed far more concerned with lining its pockets than providing exceptional service. This is a pet peeve of mine even when I am not paying a hugely inflated room rate for a special occasion. That said, it's very convenient to the Central train station, and clean. You can walk or take a quick train ride to a lot off different parts of Sydney - Darling Harbour, Chinatown, Circular Quay, etc. Front desk staff were friendly and adequately helpful. Nothing above and beyond when it came to guest service, but no gripes either. The temperature in our room was very difficult to balance- we were either freezing or the room was stuffy. Very litte ambience and our window looked out on an oh-so-charming brick wall. I'd say the convenient location is worth it if you're exploring Sydney a bit and paying $100 or less per night. Two nights here had us quite ready to move on to more charming accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, top hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flang
Reviews.Content: We stayed night before NYE, online bargain of $109 for twin room. Tiny, but perfectly formed. No window, strangely the single beds were joined at the head, sad i didn't take photos. The person in the other bed could not see TV. All very modern with wonderful bedding. Only downfall was the shower, too bad if you didn't want to get your hair wet, but guess you could use the shower cap, water splashed over floor. Chinese restuarant over the road with the BEST spring rolls i have ever had. MacDonalds on the corner and 7/11 over road too. We parked our car behind Mercure, they had some sort of deal. Good value for one night, would definately stay again. Reception was wonderful, young girl couldn't do enough to help. Booked us taxi for next morning and it was early! Top marks!

Reviews.Title: “1-2 nights bearable”
Reviews.Author: tsaidavidtristan
Reviews.Content: Exit Central Station n it's located just behind Mercure hotel quite easy to find, room was ok but small and a small tv n with standing shower, we were on the 2nd floor, lobby glass door is locked after 9pm and can be access by your key card to come in, we paid AUS $161 but it was ok just for one night as we flew home the next day, and if you are flying in better to take a taxi here

Reviews.Title: “Basic , clean central location and good for the money”
Reviews.Author: londonbabe73
Reviews.Content: Got a cheap $99 pn deal online over Xmas got a superior room on the 5 th floor this is a step up from travel lodge ie no restaurant or breakfast but there are plenty of places nearby. Room had a kettle and fridge so you can bring your own food in ( great for mega expensive sydney) also they have a laundry for $7 ( wash and dry ) on the ground floor. Wifi is a rip off ( $10 per HOUR ) but there is a mc Donalds within 5 mins walk and you get it for free. This is right by central station so it is easy to get around and there is a fre bus 555 from the station down to circular quay which helps to save the pennies .

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: ohsevenphive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for walking to all of Sydney's attractions. It is close to pubs, restaurants and shopping. Yes, it is basic and yes, the airconditioning is intermittently annoying but the overall price and location make up for a lot. We got an $89 deal and for that price it is well worth it. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the location.”
Reviews.Author: mdeg2000
Reviews.Content: We chose Leisure Inn because of its location to Sydney Country Railway as we were taking a side trip to Sydney on our way to Canberra. The hotel had a special rate for 2 nights which we took advantage of after checking the reviews on TA first. We had to stay in a twin room as that was all that was available on the Saturday night. The TA reviews were correct on these 2 points: our room was tiny & had no window but as we were out & about all day that fact didn't bother us; the aircon unit near the lifts in the hall was noisy but luckily we were far enough down the hall for it not to bother us. 'Craig' took our booking by 'phone, & he was extremely helpful & friendly. The other reception staff were good; our room was clean; everything bar the radio (too low) worked well; security good - doors locked after 9pm (guests have access card); few mins walk to Central Railway Station, light rail & buses; walk to restaurants. We would stay here again but in a double room next time ( we viewed one & it was spacious with windows) - especially if we can get a 'special' rate again (ie $88 per night, min 2 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap yet nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrisw0440
Reviews.Content: Clean and practice budget accommodation. Friendly and helpful staff but annoying that you have to pay to store baggage after check out

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: eternalquest23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mainly to attend a concert at the entertainment centre,which is walking distance. Reception is closed after 9pm so you are given a swipe card to get back in. Room was clean and comfortable. Good bed,room to move around. Bathroom very cramped,didnt like it at all.For the cheap price $136 its fine for a night. $50 on credit card on checkin then refunded. We had three rooms in our group and the other two rooms had no windows and felt like prison cells. I did notice a big air con unit in the hallway close to our room but it didnt bother us at all. Hotel is close to pubs and eating places. Close to train and buses.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: marikajane
Reviews.Content: Was a small cosy room looking out onto the street, the room was neat and tidy and the telly had extra complimentary Austar channels it was very convenient as it was close to central station and walking distance to all the great food at Chinatown and bargains at Paddy's. Walking distance to an awesome pub, 3 wise monkeys and just overall great for the active traveller. However did not like the showerheads at this place, they just didn't work very well. Can't really complain, was pretty decent!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay,Nice,Smooth and Everything”
Reviews.Author: GregyNosky
Reviews.Content: All of the staff are friendly,that is why im so pleasure to stay in this hotel.All of them Entertained their guest,i was impressed for that.Their Hotel are also clean especially their bed that so smooth,nice shower,great services,And most of it im so comfortable in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a central location”
Reviews.Author: starlene45
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights with my boyfriend while visiting Sydney for the first time. It's a little bit of a long walk to Darling Harbour from here, but you go by Paddy's Markets and Chinatown on the way so you can sort of do it in stages. The hotel is small but clean, modern, with friendly staff and a functioning elevator. We slept well and I don't remember it being noisy or anything. I think we paid around $85 / night at the time and we were going to stay here again but now it's over $100 / night to come back in June so I think we're going to try our luck elsewhere. My only complaint is that it was kind of hard to find small cafes or restaurants in the area - it seemed to be only fast food or fancy restaraunts, but we also didn't look particularly hard. Anyway I really liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Description to describe the standard room could be clearer”
Reviews.Author: rickylim33
Reviews.Content: In summary: 1) I called earlier in the day to advise i will be checking in after reception hours. They lady advise that i could either call before 9pm to get the instructions, or use the intercom upon arrival. Around 8pm, i called to try to get the instructions for after hour check in, but the person answering the phone, told us to use the intercom. This contradicts what the lady had told me in the morning. Upon arrival, I used the intercom and spoke to a man whose accent made it hard to understand. Even with a customer who was staying at the hotel assisting us, we still had no luck. Had to try to use the intercom again and try hard to understand the man, before we finally found the area to access the key safe. 2) Upon entering, notice that the carpet had orange stains and was dirty with about 15 fluffs scattered near the entry way. 3) The grout/tiles in the bathroom was grey coloured and seemed dirty. 4) When i booked this room, i didn't expect my room to have no windows. I understand from reading management's that there is 2 tier room. However, it would be more informative to customers if your description of the standard room actually indicated "no windows". This would then give the right expectation to new customers. Had i known, i would not have booked the standard room which felt like a prison. 5) The description also stated foxtel. However, this was just the basic foxtel package, and did not have Fox sports at all. Which was disappointing. Most hotel description, when they say "foxtel", they have most channels, not just about 8 foxtel channels. 6) As others have pointed out, the air cond unit is still very noisy. It seems the engineers have not really fixed the noise issue. In summary, I think i would rather spend a bit more money on a better accommodation outside in Sydney city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient... and very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: lemonbee
Reviews.Content: We really liked the room when we first entered. The trouble with this place is that there is an old generator or airconditioning unit next to the elevator that makes the most horrible humming noise for about 20 minutes every 2-3 hours that permeates throughout the first few rooms on each floor eg. rooms x01-x07. The noise ruins an otherwise great hotel. Other than the noise, this hotel is great value for money, close to everything, safe, clean beds, fridge, tv, great shower/toilet. Fix that generator, management!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Thepom
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel in Sydney is hard to better, it is right next to Central Station just south of Sydney city itself. The disappointing thing about hotel itself though is the size of the standard room. It should be made clear when booking that the standard room is the size of a prison cell, with little to no natural light. This was not made clear to us, and if it was I would have paid the extra for a room with windows to the outside world.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jackabelle
Reviews.Content: Sometimes we think cheap is the way to go. Not here. Rather like budget aiines this is one of those hotels that will do everything it can to charge you extra for the things you expected to come as part of your room rate. The service is basic to poor at very best, check out 10 mins late and you WILL be charged, want to leave a bag at the hotel after check out?? You will be charged. The rooms are appalling, one of mine was right next to a generater of some kind, it didn't stop all night. Another of my rooms (I stayed for nearly 2 weeks), was up the other end of the corridor and I could still hear it all night long. My first room had no window and no source of natural light. I was told that my upgraded room didn't include a window! My next room DID include a window, but incredibly 2 feet behind the window was a massive red wall! I couldnt see the bottom nor the top of the wall (or side of the next building), again this offered no natural light or fresh air. As a result of the the rooms have a dour smell. The carpets were stained, old and very cheap, rather like much in this hotel. Although the sheets were clean. I also had some articles stolen from my room. The hotel staff didn't want to know about this and appeared to have no process or desire for dealing with complaints. The Internet didn't work anywhere in the building, I was locked out of the laundry room (which is the staff toliet -grim), despite staff being on site and the lift was older and slower than anything I've seen. I had pre-booked 2 weeks stay, I had tried to get out of remainder of my stay but was told I would lose all my money. I guess the management will stay this ins't a luxury hotel, but that doesn't excuse awful service and fundamental short cuts in their offering. I would say it isn't a hotel. I felt like I was in jail. M

Reviews.Title: “Great location for transportation.”
Reviews.Author: techdaddy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit small and our window opened to another building 2ft away but great location to Central Station for trains and buses and ferries which will get you anywhere in Sydney and beyond. Perfect if you are out and about all day. Very helpful staff. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “city weekender -”
Reviews.Author: PossumGully
Reviews.Content: Stayed in superior queen room and found it clean with plenty of space - hotel is close to rail however double glazing cuts out all the external noise. Best for travel without a car as only 3 minutes walk to Central Railway Station. No on street parking overnight so +$20 if you had to park in a Wilson carparking station. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, kind of dismal room”
Reviews.Author: cmj5060
Reviews.Content: This room is functional and wonderfully near the train station. I have never stayed in a hotel room without a window before. It makes a big difference. There was a room nearby roaring with physical plant. We could hear it from the room, which made a big difference. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: margcc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly close to central, but due to poor directions I actually walked for close to half an hour, and stopped for directions once before I found it. the room was a queen standard and was quite small. not overly clean either. the window opens to another building so no natural light and the air-conditioner was really ineffectual. Given what I paid ($214 for 2 nights) I wouldn't stay there again. WIFI was expensive as well

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: girlsinging
Reviews.Content: This was possibly the best bargain we've ever found for accommodation - a $75 room booked during a sale (Travelzoo, from memory - ?) ... and we were thrilled with it. We were nervous after reading some of these reviews, but delighted with the hotel. Yes, it's pretty basic, no frills accommodation. Yes, the lift is small. Yes, the furnishings aren't flash. Yes, they may tell you at reception that you can't get the complimentary upgrade (which was part of the booking 'subject to availability') because it's such a 'busy time of year'. But for a cheap night's accommodation in the middle of Sydney, what do you expect?? This was the bargain of the century for us. The hallway on our floor, and our room, had good quality new carpet. The vanity unit in the bathroom looked almost new. The mattresses were firm and felt very new. The TV was a small modern LCD, with a few free Foxtel channels. Our twin room was small and very narrow, with two single beds butted against each other head-to-head along the wall, with a low partition to separate them. Both bedheads had lamps attached. There was a cupboard to hang clothes, a writing desk and chair, a small fridge ... and that's about it for furnishings. Like I said, nothing flash. Bathroom was clean, shower head was 'rainforest' style and felt strangely luxurious in such a quirky little room ... aircon worked and was quiet, colours were fairly neutral and there was NO outside noise - not bad for half a block from George Street. We felt safe in the hotel and our door had swipe cards which worked without fault. We were staying overnight for a concert at the Entertainment Centre - we walked to the venue and had dinner at Chinatown beforehand. We really only used the room to shower and sleep - and it was great. No natural light, but we weren't there to look out the window so it didn't bother us. We wouldn't stay at this hotel for a special event, or for an extended stay, but for a quick overnighter it was ideal. Less than 5 mins walk to Central Station (which is 10 mins on train direct to/from airport), friendly reception staff who gave us a noon checkout, and did I mention it's CHEAP??!! We would definitely stay there again - it's not for everyone, and certainly not for the style-conscious traveller, but for a budget room to lay your head on clean fresh sheets, nice pillows and a comfy mattress, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “what a surprise in the centre of sydney... clean, recently refurbished and reasonably good value for money”
Reviews.Author: anniebee-7779
Reviews.Content: we had 2 nights at this hotel as we were going to a concert. it was a nice 10 minute stroll to the entertainment centre. it's just a 5 minute walk from central station. very friendly staff on arrival. our room was quite large, modern, quiet and very clean and comfortable. we paid a bit extra to have the quieter room - $120/night. the only thing we didn't like was being forced to sign a pre authorization for $50 on the credit card 'in case' ...??? its not like there's a mini bar in the room (although there was a bottle of water!) maybe this is standard practice for hotels nowadays but we've never had to do it before... apart from that we thought the hotel was great value and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average 2-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: RRic
Reviews.Content: Average 2-star hotel. Be careful if you book a twin room. The setup of the standard twin room and superior twin room is horrible. In the bathroom, there is no mirror in front of the basin. The mirror is on the door and you have to turn around everytime you want to look at the mirror. The walls are not thick and you can hear people talking and toilets flushing.

Reviews.Title: “No sense of security...”
Reviews.Author: lacamas
Reviews.Content: The door had a deadbolt knob but on closer inspection, a bolt did not come out nor did the door jamb have a hole to receive a bolt if there was one. I can't believe that no one has mentioned this (or I didn't get to a review that did). Maybe the knob was left on the door to provide guests with a false sense of security. When traveling, security is always our main concern. So if it is yours...do not stay here. Front desk kept assuring me that Sydney is a safe city. Meantime I am watching the news on their tv that a skeleton was dug up nearby. The girl at the front desk insisted that if I just turned the deadbolt (?) no one can gain access to the room with a key card. My daughter and I tried it many different ways, (thinking that it mus the some newfangled electronic thing) but each time we were able to open the door. She also claimed that no one can gain access to our floor since you need a key card to operate the elevator to get to the corresponding floor...not true. Her lying did not assuage my concerns. She finally gave us a different room. A much, much smaller room but I decided to take it because in this room I was able to jam the chair against a concrete post by the door which provided me some sense of security. Breakfast for A$7.95 consisted of a paper sack with a carton of milk, orange juice, mini box of cereal, mini-granola bar, a plastic bowl and a spoon. When I clicked on the link from Travelzoo, it said that there was free one hour at the lobby Internet kiosk. At check-in I was told that there was a limited number of rooms they sell that had the offer and by the time I completed my registration, those must have already sold out because my booking on their system did not show the free Internet. No way for me to know based on the confirmation I received by email. It was a bait and switch, I'd say. If an honest place is what you want...this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location and service”
Reviews.Author: erneztp
Reviews.Content: I had no problem staying in this hotel. Sure it was a no frills boutique hotel but the service was friendly, the room was clean and tidy, and it has a spot on location just beside the central station. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Practical!”
Reviews.Author: Bata403
Reviews.Content: A great location and amazingly practical and clean rooms make this hotel a 'best value stay'. Highly recommended for the traveller on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Ratio "Quality-Price"”
Reviews.Author: jk1020
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers an optimum ratio quality-price. The cost of the double room was 80 AUD per night. The room was clean, comfortable, with a nice bathroom and equipped with TV and air conditioned. The hotel is really close to the train station, thus it is possible to reach the downtown or the circular quay (harbour bridge and Opera House) in 10 minutes. Unfortunately, internet connection was an extra. The only remark is the cost to leave there the luggage after the check out (2 AUD per item).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DeniseNorthAvocaNSW
Reviews.Content: Once again I use Ubid4rooms web site and was able to get a great price even though it was a Friday. With the web site now taking bookings 3 months ahead, I was lucky to book early for the twin room as they were all booked out close to the date. We were just looking for somewhere close to the railstation and city for the evening, it was perfect as it slept us 3 in single beds..The rooms were very clean and staff great.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but small and no window”
Reviews.Author: RitchieBusey
Reviews.Content: Was a good rate at $80. But there was no indication on their website of the room I would really get. This room was no more than 6 feet wide by 25 feet long. The bathroom was nice. The room was clean with single beds end to end. A small monitor was your TV. It had what I needed, but was not in any way what I expected from the pictures online. There was NO window to look out, let alone some view. It was close to Central Station although I found out a shuttle is no more expensive than taking the train to the airport. Internet is $10 per hour so just go around the corner to the right and across the street for $2 per hour.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ritapaola
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, central and cheap. It looks like the hotel has gone through some renovations although it is not flash it is a good place to stay at a cheap price. It is right near central station which is convenient and the staff were helpful. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate on a budget but be aware of noise issues”
Reviews.Author: meandstar
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the strange feature of air conditioner compressor units located in a cupboard on each floor in hallway . Unit on floor 5 seemed more noisey than other floors and my room was near it and could hear it quite clearly in my room . Asked to be moved and was ( after receptionist asked if I would like an extra blanket to cover my head with for the noise) Room moved to was at end of corridor on another floor away from unit so was fine. Be aware if you stay to ask for room at far end of corridor away from lifts . Rooms are clean and comfortable but also be aware that they have a lot of rules ,e.g. strict 10am check out otherwise you pay extra each hour , long list of conditions that you sign on check in ,expensive internet . Receptionist was very helpful with changing rooms and manager acknowledged noise issue but the level of hospitality and service here very basic .

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price, but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: DrCrazyA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Leisure Inn Sydney Central at the beginning and end of our trip to Australia and New Zealand. We chose it because the rates for other hotels in Sydney were quite high for what they were offering, and figured since we weren't going to be spending much time in the room anyway, it would be fine. The rooms are bare bones basic accomodations that are definitely on the small side. We had one room with a view of a brick wall and then one room with no windows at all. If you plan to spend any time chilling in your room, it can get pretty depressing. Liked: - It's closer to the airport than other central Sydney hotels. It costs about the same for 2 people to take the airport shuttle as it does a taxi (28 to 30 AUD). If you are traveling alone, the airport shuttle is cheaper at 14 AUD one way. -Our airport shuttle (which we booked with reception) was horribly late due to an undisclosed "problem", and the receptionist on duty spent over 20 minutes on the phone with the shuttle company and attending to us. We were refunded our shuttle fare and he gave us enough to pay for a taxi to the airport. Disliked: -It's on the periphery of central Sydney, by Chinatown, so it's a bit of a hike to get to the main sighs like the Rocks or ferry terminals. If you don't mind the walk it isn't a problem. The neighborhood isn't dangerous at all but it's not great. -Our blanket obviously had not been washed since it was last used by another guest. There was a caked on stain, either from milk or something more unpleasant. -Our drinking glasses were also dirty. Maybe they had been rinsed but definitely not been washed with soap. -The maid left our door open (!) after cleaning one night. We immediately reported it to reception asked us if anything had been taken, but then also informed is that they knew that particular door had been having some issues and the maids had accidentally left it open in the past. Nothing was taken but I don't understand why precautions weren't already taken by housekeeping if they already knew about this problem. I appreciated the efforts of the staff attending to our needs during our stays there, but I would not stay here again due to what I consider unacceptable security problems and unsanitary conditions. Unwashed glasses and linens, and maids leaving doors open are issues that just shouldn't exist in a hotel in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: annika81
Reviews.Content: The front desk service was great, they were very helpful and friendly. The bed was comfy and the room was warm and a relatively good size. Pretty simple but all the facilities needed for an overnight stay, great shampoo, body wash, moisturizing etc etc and an amazing shower! But.. There was no view or natural light, the only window looked out onto a brick building which was almost in arms reach, also the fluro lights in the room didnt help this! The hotel is situated a few min walk from central station and is so close to town so this is a BIG bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Not good, not bad, just keep it for the last choice”
Reviews.Author: ake115
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is a bit away from the city centre. It could takes up to 15 mins to walk to World Square, or Towns hall. Nearby area is quite quiet during the night, but looks safe. The room itself is just basic, nothing impressive. Lots of scratches on the wall makes the room looked unmaintained. Bed is adequately large and comfy. 6-Channel-limited small LCD TV is functional. Overall conditions are clean. Bathroom is equipped with a rain shower only, no normal one which i much prefer is presented. The big issue for this hotel is their air-condition system. You are not able to turn it on/off by yourself. I was told by the receptionist that the air-con is centrally controlled and will automatically kick in when the outside temperature reaches some certain degree. Sounds like an intelligent system but I don't think it's practically good for a hotel where different guests have different preferences for their comfortable temperature. Staff is generally responsive, but not that impressive, and they only operate during 7am-9pm. To sum up, it's a clean hotel, a bit far from the centre, annoying air-con system, good for short stay, would be worth your penny if a rate is less than AUD90.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and decent location but do not expect anything extra”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a bit 5 minutes from the central station. The area is a bit dodgy late at night but the location is still pretty decent. It is close to most parts of the CBD and there is very easy access to transport. The hotel tries to give a boutique hotel feel but it does not really work. It feels more like Ibis, Travelodge or something like that. Everything is clean and it works but do not expect anything special. The room came with a queen size bed (comfy). small lcd-TV, fridge, iron, kettle, hair dryer etc. The remote for the TV was broken (it was not fixed or replaced, they replaced the batteries two times even after I insisted it was not the batteries). The view from the room was of a brick wall (if the window would have opened I could easily have touched it). That actuyally brings down the overall impression as the already small room feels even smaller since there is virtually no light coming in from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and basic but a great deal”
Reviews.Author: Dynamac
Reviews.Content: We were on a short break to Sydney and needed a 'easy on the eye', clean and simple accommodation in the city for a good price. After reading reviews we decided on Leisure Inn. The hotel was basic and rooms are quite small. However room/bathroom was very clean at all times and we were only spending time in the room to sleep. The bed was fine and decor was modern. There was a small LCD TV and bar fridge in the room. There was no mini toiletries, these were in dispensers on the wall, but always full. As we arrived late (around 10pm by the time we got there) the front desk was closed, but I called from the airport and got clear check in instructions from the friendly and patient front desk staff. As we paid online, we basically did not deal with the staff from there on, but there was never any other issues for us on our stay. We took the train to central and it was an easy walk to the hotel. The area though near central station was never very scary for me and my girlfriend. Although getting to the centre of the city/darling harbour wasnt that easy as just for a short ride, it costs alot on the train. It was however very close to chinatown. We had a view directly of a brick wall although that was never really a concern. There was no street noise, but the doors are thin and there was a slit between the door and the floor so it was quite easy to hear noise from doors slamming and the hallway. We didnt hear anything from another room though. Overall I'm very happy with my choice and for the savings I could easily take the train and/or take a taxi from darling harbour or the quay back to hotel and still save plenty. Tip: unless you are coming alone from the airport, just get a taxi into the city, it costs less than 2 train tickets (at $16 a pop).

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists, maybe businessmen”
Reviews.Author: RichardHNottingham
Reviews.Content: With check out at 10:00am enforced with heavy "fine" for each hour after, also no baggage storage after check out, and no staff in hotel after 9:00pm in the evening we felt very unsafe. Very expensive internet.

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: dudefromNL
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was amazing, just around the corner was central station. Fortunately you can't hear a thing from anything happening outside. The room itself was a little noisy though, slamming doors can be heard quite well. The furniture was all reasonably new and the bathroom was in great condition. I really liked the soap/shampoo/conditioner and by the sink the soap/bodylotion/shavingcream dispensers. The room had a good size. + great location + good value for money + friendly staff - overpriced ($20 / 24h) and terribly functioning wireless internet - airco is automatic, you can't turn it on or off A great place to stay when you're visiting to view Sydney. Staff is always helpfull and it covers all the basic needs.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable location and value”
Reviews.Author: GrannyMarg
Reviews.Content: I'm a senior, stayed here on the recommendation of my daughter and found it even better than expected.Great decor, helpful staff and proximity to Central Station, George Street, Paddy's Market and Darling Harbour-couldn't fault it.definitely hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but good price and location”
Reviews.Author: KiwisInCanberra
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Leisure Inn Sydney â€“ this time we booked a standard room. We were lucky and were upgraded to an Executive Queen (where I think the difference is a window in the room). On the positives, on foot it is 2 minutes to Central Station, 5 minutes to Paddyâ€™s Market and China Town, and 15 minutes to Darling Harbour. The room is clean and tidy, and housekeeping comes daily. There is small cafÃ© next door for cheap, good breakfasts on Saturday (but not Sunday), and 7-Eleven, McDonalds, and KFC are just around the corner. You can park nearby at one of about four parking venues (around $25 per 24 hours on the weekend). However, on the downside, it is a basic hotel, and you get what you pay for â€¦ a bed and bathroom. The bathroom is very small with the toilet right next to the wall, so anyone who is larger than average may have an awkward time. The toilet is no longer fixed fully to the floor (I suspect due to its proximity to the wall) and now wobbles, so be careful when sitting on it. Also, the hotel does not provide face cloths or a plug for the hand basin. While initially cheap, you are charged for any â€œextrasâ€�. Late check-out is possible, but incurs a fee â€“ an additional $20 to check out by 11am, and so on. There is no reception service after 9pm and will need your door key to get into the hotel. If you leave both your keys in your room and try to get in after hours, you will be charged a call-out fee of $70. After checking out, you can store your luggage, but it will cost $2 per item. Overall, it is ideal if you are spending only one or two nights in Sydney, and using the room simply for sleeping and showering. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “1 Night Easy”
Reviews.Author: sezza01
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at the Leisure Inn for 1 night, we arrrive late at night so we only need a cheap place to crash. this place was perfect for a quick one night stop. the room was small, but the bed was comfortable, the room was modern and nice, the shower was huge!! but there was no window, so it was kinda like sleeping in a box . when i woke up i couldnt tell if it was the middle of the night or 8 in the morning :P i would only recomend this place for a cheap nice1 night stay. unless your a vanpire and like small dark places. lol.

Reviews.Title: “great value budget hotel but only suitable for short stays”
Reviews.Author: theproo
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid and location of the hotel, I was really expecting a dump of a place. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was modern furnished with Ikea-like furniture. We had no window but I'd rather have a windowless, clean room than a dirty room with a window. The location was great and Sydney is small enough to walk to all the major attractions from the hotel. Tip: the taxi to/from the airport was a little less than the train we initially took, presumably due to the hotel's southerly location.

Reviews.Title: “One time is enough”
Reviews.Author: goodsmile
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. First, it was ok because the location was good, very near the central train station. Most of staff are friendly. The toilet was very small like other reviewer wrote. But before I moved out, I left one lamp at the hotel which wasn't worth much and since I was still in Sydney, I came back to the hotel and asked for it. The receptionist told me that it was lost! How can I be? Because I came back one day after I checked out and the maid must have kept it when she finished cleaning my room before the next guest arrived. Anyway, she told me that it was lost and that gave me bad impression even if it was only small thing. So before you left any hotels, please check carefully!!! By the way, after you check out and want to left the bags at this hotel, they charge you $2 per item!!!!!! Shouldn't the service be included the the room we pay? That was the first time I was paid for the left baggage and I will be my last time there. Oh, and if you want to use credit card there, they charge you 1.5-2% too.

Reviews.Title: “Unopenable window with inadequate ventilation”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and thought i was quite good initially. However since my last stay I decided I could not go back again. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's 3 minute walk from Central Station. It's clean and newly renovated. For this price you can only get a ensuite room in a hostel in this location. I usually only stay for 1 or 2 nights, and it wasn't until my last (which I stayed for a whole week) that I discovered a major problem. The windows in the room can't be opened, and there is no individual controllable air conditioning in the room. There is central air conditioning for the whole building, but it is extremely weak. Therefore the ventilation is extremely poor, and for most of the week I felt like I couldn't breath. Eventually I had to check out early. The front desk is not staffed after 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but check out your alloted room first”
Reviews.Author: jigarNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and it is close to the Central station, clean and with helpful office staff. However when we got to our room we were shocked to find it was not much wider than a hallway with the two single beds end to end, not much room for 2 people to pass each other,a small bathroom and no external window, the only light being from an internal small opaque window. We had booked sometime ahead so asked for a change of room but was told it was fully booked. While we agree that the price was very reasonable for Sydney the room should be portrayed on the website and people who suffer even slightly from claustrophobia would be able to choose another room. It would however suit people wanting quietness as no traffic noise was audible.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: superQ
Reviews.Content: Needed a stop-over for a night so only wanted cheap basic but clean hotel near the Central Railway station. This hotel ticked all the boxes. Paid $135 for a superior Queen and single but was upgraded to a Family room so couldn't be happier. Very spacious room with two Queens and a single. Furnishing was simple and basic, but everything was very clean and working. Beds very comfortable. Flat screen TV was on the small side but picture quality good with a fair selection of channels. Room was dark without much natural lighting but lots of overhead and bedside light fixtures. Adequate storage for two adults and one child, but might be a bit lacking for a full contingent of five individuals. Large spacious and clean bathroom. All in all a good and cheap/value for money alternative for budget conscious or for those who simply want a no-fuss place to sleep for the night

Reviews.Title: “Central location, basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: TAAMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Clean, renovated, basic rooms. Internet charges are excessive - $12 per hour, or $20 for 24 hours !! I stayed for business, so the wireless internet charges affected me greatly :( However, if you are staying here for leisure purposes, then there are lots of cheap internet cafes around. The hotel is located around the corner from Central Railway Station and a major bus terminal, and there are lots of restaurants, bars and eateries within a comfortable 5-10 minute walk. Broadway shopping centre is also a 5 minute walk away. There is no parking available at this hotel. Street parking is super expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: tronski
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room (4 adults) for 2 nights. The room was HUGE! It was in a 'L' shape with a window at one end, fridge, desk and TV. There were 2 double beds and one single. The double beds were placed so you couldn't see each other - good for privacy. Big double wardrobe. The bathroom was huge - our only problem was the shower. It had disabled access and just a shower curtain seperating from the rest of the room. This resulted in wet floors - bit slippy but no real problem. Shower is a rainforest head type - you can't move it so you get your hair wet (unless you wear the cap provided). Location is good. Couple of minutes to Central Station/Buses. Less than $2 on bus to get to Circualr Quay. 10 mins walk to China Town and Darling Harbour. Our only problem was the noise from the air con system. It was quite loud and went on all the time. Constant banging and clicking. I'd stay again though - can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with Few Faults”
Reviews.Author: timtooth
Reviews.Content: I would echo most of the previous positive comments. Our room was a little over A$700 for a week through Wotif and we got a fairly spacious room one floor up from reception with a good view of the street and no traffic noise (I guess the configuration of rooms varies widely in this strange shaped building). There are plenty of bus and train options nearby and I never felt anything but safe even on Regent Street as you are very close to Broadway which was busy even very late. Staff were always helpful and the room was clean and well serviced. We were able to store our extensive baggage (bike boxes and regular cases) on the last day for as long as we required. They even called the day before we arrived to tell us that the elevator was out of order in case that was a problem (and it was fixed soon after our arrival). The only real negatives were a slow elevator (the security system requires swiping your key to make it move after waiting a while for the doors to close) and the ridiculous price for internet (go around the corner to Everywhere Internet on Broadway: clean, comfortable and A$1.50-2/ hour). I recommend the place and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for what I paid”
Reviews.Author: woodsjc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a fantastic price on a "secret" deal on what turned out to be the busiest weekend in Sydney since the Olympics. Rooms are small but have been done up very nicely, same with the bathrooms. Was excited to get the top floor, until I found the window looked out onto a brick wall, but the way the building is, not many rooms would have a view. Location was good, not far from the rail station, easy walk to Chiinatown, or cheap bus fare to the Rocks etc. Found the desk staff very helpful and friendly. For what I paid, it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: sng8888
Reviews.Content: Cheap deal via "secret" hotel booking site. Location is just off the Central train station. It's a little quiet at night as it's the only business open on this short street so it might frighten single travellers although your feeling of safety may be more based on perception than reality as Sydney is quiet safe. Hotel has limited front desk hours. Modern boutique like features but a limited service hotel for sure. My room was a cheap "secret" hotel so may have been not one of the better ones. Although clean and functional with a small LCD TV, I didn't have any windows! Hallways are institutional. New card locks is good. Comfortable bed. Rooms are clean. Small soap bars.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP26
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a twin room for 3 nights, and this hotel was absolutely fine. We arrived quite late after reception had closed, and the receptionist had phoned earlier in the day to give us instructions on how to get into the hotel and get our key out of the key safe. This all worked fine with no problems at all. Room was an unusual shape (long and thin), but perfectly acceptable with twin beds, a large desk area, wardrobes, tea and coffee facilities and an extensive range of TV channels. Bathroom was very small, but certainly adequate. Hotel provided a guest laundry. Location is good. It's in the CBD, very close to the Central railway station where you can both local subway trains and regional services to places like the Blue Mountains. Stayed in this place because my favourite Sydney hotel, which is more centrally located, was full. While I would still go for my favourite hotel on future trips to Sydney, if it were again full then I would have no hesitation in staying here again as my second choice.

Reviews.Title: “Totally not what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Not really a Hotel, seemed more like a renovated college dorm room. Room is pretty small area lighting is very poor. The bathroom is smaller than pictures posted could indicate. The toilet is right up against the side of the bathroom with no space to sit down, properly. Also note, you have to badge in & out to get in/out of the hotel after 9pm, there is no one at the front desk. Location close to Central railway--off the main street--close to China town. We were not able to adjust the air conditioner settings. According to the front desk the whole building is air-conditioned at the same temperature...no changes. Felt like we were going to catch a cold. After staying there for one night we cancelled our reservations & paid the extra one night cancellation fee (booked through check-in.com). Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly & for Sidney really cheap”
Reviews.Author: sewaterman
Reviews.Content: Looked at Sydney hotel prices [anyone know why Australian hotels are so expensive for what you get ?] read the Trip Advisor reviews on this one and booked on their web site. Great to deal with, very friendly - room was fairly small but very clean & comfortable - really good value for money. There's a full laundry room downstairs with washer, drier & iron - $3 each machine & iron is free. Can park at the Mercur if like us you have a rental car. Excellent breakfast at Wake Up ! - a little coffee bar just beyond the place where the buses stop, fresh fruit, yogurt & great coffee, and good Italian food for dinner at Sopranos, just east of the station.. Recomended to anyone who wants somewhere convenient & very good value in Sydney...

Reviews.Title: “clean, good deal”
Reviews.Author: JuniorAK
Reviews.Content: we were looking for a cheap place but not a hostel and this worked out great. located a bit south of the harbour but certainly within walking distance, maybe 30-40mins? its right off the main streets so as you walk to the harbour there is plenty of shopping and cafes to keep you busy, or you can take a 3min walk to the central train station and go from there. the rooms are small, but get it done. a bathroom with shower, toilet, full size bed, and little 20" lcd tv with several channels. this is not really the place to stay for lounging, more like somewhere to just put your stuff in and sleep. while we were there, the a/c was pretty noisey, but a call to the front desk seemed to get it working better. overall there seemed to be lack of air circulation since our wet clothes (bathing suits) never seemed to beable and dry inside the room. the rooms themselves seem secure, you need to card access the lobby at night, then card access in the elevator to get to your floor, so that gave a safe feeling. in your room, you could definetely hear ppl in the hallways through your door, but the walls seemed to insulate, once noisey ppl went into their rooms and shut their doors you could never hear them. if youre looking for a cheap, clean, safe place and not too worried about being further from the harbour action, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: folkestad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value in central sydney... I paid just over US$100/night but the place was spotlessly clean, completely new, great sunshine in the room (with drapes open) and quiet. I am a business traveler and am very particular, and I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to business or pleasure travelers. I must say that it is NOT in the center of the CBD, but a short bus/taxi ride or a 20 minute walk. Please note that there is an early (and strict) check out time of 10am, and there is no luggage storage (although exceptions can be made, it seems). Also, the internet charge in the hotel is high (as is the rest of Sydney) - try Boingo instead, and save a lot. Barbara, who works at the front desk, is very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So Blessed”
Reviews.Author: JIReehmann
Reviews.Content: After getting ejected by our hotel as the city was "FULL" we found this hotel that just opened. The location was next to the railway station. Never in our life have we had such wonderful people look after our needs. The rooms where small but the bed was ahh so comfortable. The lack of city noise and darkness in the room contributed to the really great sleep. We also missed half a day playing tourist as we stayed in and watched Animal planet. MY Husband and i really enjoyed the second half of our holiday in ths property, being ejected from a "4.5" star property to this 3.5 star was the best thing. I would stay here every time we come to sydney without fail and will recommend it to friends as well unashamedly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quiet Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussietiger
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure to stay at this hotel twice in the past few months and was very impressed with it. The staff are very friendly, the hotel is very clean and quiet and so close to all in the city. The location being next to Central Railway Station is an asset and make it very easy to get to all locations whilst on holidays. The renovations to this hotel have made it nice and fresh with quality fittings and a pleasure to spend time in.

Reviews.Title: “we like it”
Reviews.Author: acteck
Reviews.Content: however,we stayed in this hotel for only 2 days, i think it is very good place to stay in Sydney, near central station. It looks like it has been renovated recently, so everything is new and in very good condition. As far as i can jadge, it is convinient and comfortable enought for this price. In additon, the staff was friendly. Overall i would say this is good hotel and it worth to stay there and enjoy your staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SarahCF
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Sydney - close to transport and restaurants, affordable, very friendly staff. Rooms were on the small side but very well equipped and comfy. Would definitely stay there again next time we travel to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Eriny
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in a very comfortable room ,excellent shower great service the best of everything. You will be or first port of call when we are in Sydney again, thanks heaps. Ernie

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asco10
Reviews.Content: A pleasant, new and very clean hotel, absolute value for money. Fantastic hotel for business travellers all rooms have WiFi. As a females travelling alone, I felt very save there. Staff were very helpful, friendly. I was able to check in early. Within walking distance to the Central Station and bus station, Powerhouse Museum, TAFE etc. Room was small, but tasteful, comfortable and functional, and smelled fresh. The bed was bliss. The hotel, though central, is quiet, and I got a good night sleep. The bathroom was superclean / spotless. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “nothing”
Reviews.Author: xpsoftware
Reviews.Content: not very nice hotel, but very secure

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great location”
Reviews.Author: RoyAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel , very clean and well furnished rooms for the price . Helpful staff and well within walking distance of Darling Harbour and local amenities. Did everything we expected of it and would use again next time we are in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: frequentflier007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this new hotel in the beginning of October for two nights. We found the staff to be very pleasant and unobtrusive and the lobby and room secure and quiet. The room appears exactly as it looks on the website and the bed was firm but comfortable and the double glazed windows blocked out all the noise of the station and city streets below. Initially we had a little trouble finding the hotel, as this was our first time to Sydney, we had a car, and Regent St isn't very well marked on the two maps we used. So for further reference the hotel is on a part of Regent St that is an extension of Harris St. We found resonibly priced parking on Thomas St off Quay St approx $18 per 24 hours which was cheaper than the recommended carpark of $25 per 24 hours. We dropped off our bags at the hotel (4 hr parking out front) and then leisurely drove the car round and left it in the carpark for 2 days. The area has some great asian food and felt safe and active at night when we returned to the hotel. The location next to the station made it very easy to navigate around the city on a day tripper pass. We found the decor modern, tasteful and very very clean and the only critism would be that a bedside table would be convenient and perhaps the flat screen tv would be more easily visible if mounted on the wall - oh, and a cd player would be nice but not essential! We will definiely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveloctopus
Reviews.Content: The staff at this new hotel were friendly, and had an interest in their guests - always a positive. As for the room (double bed room), it was very tiny, the bed took up much of the room. Bed and shower facilities were brand new, and excellent. The LCD television screen was a delight as well. One thing I found disappointing about the hotel was the lack of amenities and in-room facilities. Due to the location of this hotel, there is no option of expansion in the way of restaurants, gym, sauna, pool, etc. I suppose that is a trade off with the excellent proximity to Central Station. That's understandable. However, I was disappointed that there was no in-room information on television channels, wireless access, reception details, local shops and services - the usual brochures and such. Very happy with the last minute price I got, but would consider my options a little more if I were to pay full price. Despite the lack of extra facilities, I was happy with my stay at the Central Regent.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent”
Reviews.Author: yodaful
Reviews.Content: Good location close to most things in the city. Rooms are quite small but a great place to stay if you just want a bed to crash in after a night out.

HotelInfo.Name: Leisure Inn Sydney Central
HotelInfo.Address: 28 - 30 Regent St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Central Regent Hotel)
